title: RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > Prerequisite > What Do You Need? > Prerequisites for Using RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Module
content: Before going through each and every step on using the RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Module, make sure to prepare the necessary items listed below:
parent_content: Before going through each and every step on using the RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Module, make sure to prepare the necessary items listed below:

title: RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > Prerequisite > What Do You Need? > Hardware > RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Module - Required Components
content:
- [RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Module](https://store.rakwireless.com/products/wisblock-water-level-sensor-rak12059?utm_source=RAK12059&utm_medium=Document&utm_campaign=BuyFromStore)
- Your choice of [WisBlock Base](https://store.rakwireless.com/collections/wisblock-base?utm_source=WisBlockBase&utm_medium=Document&utm_campaign=BuyFromStore)

- [RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Module](https://store.rakwireless.com/products/wisblock-water-level-sensor-rak12059?utm_source=RAK12059&utm_medium=Document&utm_campaign=BuyFromStore)
- Your choice of [WisBlock Base](https://store.rakwireless.com/collections/wisblock-base?utm_source=WisBlockBase&utm_medium=Document&utm_campaign=BuyFromStore)
- Your choice of [WisBlock Core](https://store.rakwireless.com/collections/wisblock-core?utm_source=WisBlockCore&utm_medium=Document&utm_campaign=BuyFromStore)
- USB Cable
- [Li-Ion/LiPo Battery (optional)](https://store.rakwireless.com/collections/wisblock-accessory/products/battery-connector-cable?utm_source=BatteryConnector&utm_medium=Document&utm_campaign=BuyFromStore)

title: RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > Prerequisite > What Do You Need? > Software > Install Arduino IDE and RAKwireless Arduino BSP
content:
- Download and install [Arduino IDE.](https://www.arduino.cc/en/Main/Software)
- To add the RAKwireless Core boards to your Arduino Boards Manager, install the [RAKwireless Arduino BSP.](https://github.com/RAKWireless/RAKwireless-Arduino-BSP-Index)
parent_content:
- Download and install [Arduino IDE.](https://www.arduino.cc/en/Main/Software)
- To add the RAKwireless Core boards to your Arduino Boards Manager, install the [RAKwireless Arduino BSP.](https://github.com/RAKWireless/RAKwireless-Arduino-BSP-Index)

title: RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > Product Configuration > Hardware Setup > RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Overview and Mounting
content: The WisBlock Sensor RAK12059 is a liquid-level measurement sensor. It uses MILONE's proprietary eTape sensor products with different active lengths. For more information about RAK12059, refer to the [Datasheet](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisblock/rak12059/datasheet/).
parent_content:
The WisBlock Sensor RAK12059 is a liquid-level measurement sensor. It uses MILONE's proprietary eTape sensor products with different active lengths. For more information about RAK12059, refer to the [Datasheet](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisblock/rak12059/datasheet/).  
The RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Module can be mounted on the sensor slots of the WisBlock Base board, as shown in **Figure 1**. It will work on SLOT A, C, D, E and F. Also, always secure the connection of the WisBlock module by using compatible screws.  
> **Image:** RAK12059 Connection to WisBlock Base

title: RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > Product Configuration > Hardware Setup > RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Overview and Mounting

> **Image:** RAK12059 Connection to WisBlock Base

The RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Module can be mounted on the sensor slots of the WisBlock Base board, as shown in **Figure 1**. It will work on SLOT A, C, D, E and F. Also, always secure the connection of the WisBlock module by using compatible screws.  
> **Image:** RAK12059 Connection to WisBlock Base

title: RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > Product Configuration > Hardware Setup > Assembling and Disassembling of WisBlock Modules > Assembling > How to Assemble RAK12059 to WisBlock Base
content:
As shown in **Figure 2**, the location for the sensors slots are properly marked by silkscreen. Follow carefully the procedure defined in [WisBlock Base board assembly/disassembly instructions](https://learn.rakwireless.com/hc/en-us/articles/26743966497431-How-To-Install-RAK5005-O-Baseboard/) to attach a WisBlock module. Once attached, carefully fix the module with three pieces of M1.2 x 3mm screws.  
> **Image:** RAK12059 assembly to WisBlock Base
parent_content:
As shown in **Figure 2**, the location for the sensors slots are properly marked by silkscreen. Follow carefully the procedure defined in [WisBlock Base board assembly/disassembly instructions](https://learn.rakwireless.com/hc/en-us/articles/26743966497431-How-To-Install-RAK5005-O-Baseboard/) to attach a WisBlock module. Once attached, carefully fix the module with three pieces of M1.2 x 3mm screws.  
> **Image:** RAK12059 assembly to WisBlock Base

title: RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > Product Configuration > Hardware Setup > Assembling and Disassembling of WisBlock Modules > Disassembling > How to Disassemble a WisBlock Module [STEPS]
content:
The procedure for disassembling any type of WisBlock module is the same.  
1. To begin disassembling, remove the screws.  
> **Image:** Removing screws from the WisBlock module  
2. After removing the screws, check the silkscreen of the module to find the correct location where force can be applied.  
> **Image:** Detaching silkscreen on the WisBlock module  
3. Detach the module from the base board by applying forcer to the module at the position of the connector, as shown in **Figure 5**.
parent_content:
The procedure for disassembling any type of WisBlock module is the same.  
1. To begin disassembling, remove the screws.  
> **Image:** Removing screws from the WisBlock module  
2. After removing the screws, check the silkscreen of the module to find the correct location where force can be applied.  
> **Image:** Detaching silkscreen on the WisBlock module  
3. Detach the module from the base board by applying forcer to the module at the position of the connector, as shown in **Figure 5**.  
> **Image:** Applying even forces on the proper location of a WisBlock module  
> **TIP:** NOTE  
If you will connect other modules to the remaining WisBlock Base slots, check on the [WisBlock Pin Mapper](https://learn.rakwireless.com/hc/en-us/articles/26743306645143-How-To-Use-the-WisBlock-IO-Pin-Mapping-Tool). This tool finds possible pin conflicts.  
After all this setup, you can now connect the battery (optional) and USB cable to start programming your WisBlock Core.  
> **WARNING:** - Batteries can cause harm if not handled properly.
- Only 3.7-4.2V rechargeable LiPo batteries are supported. It is highly recommended not to use other types of batteries with the system unless you know what you are doing.
- If a non-rechargeable battery is used, it has to be unplugged first before connecting the USB cable to the USB port of the board to configure the device. Not doing so might damage the battery or cause a fire.
- Only 5V solar panels are supported. Do not use 12V solar panels. It will destroy the charging unit and, eventually, other electronic parts.
- Make sure the battery wires match the polarity on the WisBlock Base board. Not all batteries have the same wiring.

title: RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > RAK12059 WisBlock Liquid Level Sensor Quick Start Guide > Product Configuration > Software Configuration and Example > Monitor Liquid Level Using MILONE eTape Probe with RAK12059
content: In this example, you will monitor the level of the liquid where the MILONE eTape probe is submerged. The eTape sensor data will be captured by the ADC chip of RAK12059 module then accessed by WisBlock Core via I2C interface.
parent_content: In this example, you will monitor the level of the liquid where the MILONE eTape probe is submerged. The eTape sensor data will be captured by the ADC chip of RAK12059 module then accessed by WisBlock Core via I2C interface.
